p: A total of 7283 samples were collected from all over the country from patients with SARI between April 2009 and December 2018. Out of the samples, 40.8% (2973/7283) of the influenza-negative ones were positive for respiratory viruses. Viruses with the highest circulation were rhinovirus/enterovirus (HRV/HEV) (47.6%), respiratory syncytial virus 15.9% (RSV) (RSV A 7.8%, RSV B 6.9% and RSV 1.2%, subgroup identification was performed by real-time RT-PCR), metapneumovirus (HMPV) (11.1%), parainfluenza 3 (PIV3) (5.1%), adenovirus (AdV) (3.0%), co-infections (10.8%), parainfluenza 1 (PIV1) (2.0%), parainfluenza 2 (PIV2) (0.6%), parainfluenza 4 (PIV4) (1.2%), coronavirus (CoV 229E) (0.9%), CoV HKU1 (0.4%), CoV NL63 (0.8%), CoV OC43 (0.5%) and Bocavirus (BoV) (0.1%). In total, 59% of the samples were negative, and 0.2% were undetermined ( Figure 1).
